nanoidr 0.2.0

    • Random ID string generation with nanoidr

Pseudo crypto.getRandomValues Web API

Source: R/utils.R
getRandomValues.Rd

The original NanoID library generates random strings with window.crypto.getRandomValues on client side environment, however, the V8 environment provides no window.crypto object. Because of this, nanoidr package replaces that function with a simple wrapper of openssl::rand_bytes().

getRandomValues(size = 21L, seed = 1234L, fix.seed = FALSE)

Arguments

size

integer (size of output).
seed

only when fix.seed is true, used for base::set.seed(). Or not, never be used.
fix.seed

default is false.

Value

list of bytes.

See also

https://developer.mozilla.org/ja/docs/Web/API/Window/crypto

Contents
